poems.title: An Approach
poems.content:
I still long for you every evening.
It's a bond‚Äî
the bloom of blushes
and eye contact still comforts me.
No matter how many new people I meet,
I still fall for you.
Like a song on loop,
the days have changed‚Äî
yet we still breathe and vibe.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: The euphoria of asking(23.46):
poems.content:
Life
Are you complete?
Maybe.
Are you ever blissful?
Maybe.
Do wishes come true?
Maybe.
Are you love?
Maybe.
Do you need someone else?
Maybe.
Are you pain?
Maybe.
Are you a melody?
Maybe.
Are you stressful?
Maybe.
Will you get better?
Maybe.

I am the aether between everything you imagine‚Äî
an unaltered expression,
a blessing to those
who acknowledge my essence,
and
a curse to those with unending grievance.
Incidents that happen
are merely possibilities and probabilities,
folded into existence by perception.
You can try to predict me,
but you will end up losing the nectar.

I am the sunflower that blooms by your radiance.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Ghosts<00.09>
poems.content:
When I had everything,
I feared ghosts.
When I am solitary,
I wander in search of ghosts.
There was a time when I hung out with my friends and family.
Exhausted from it all,
I tried sleeping on my bed,
Until a shuddery silhouette caught my sight.
Frightened, I got my torch closeby,
To lookout for any ghosts nearby.
The wind was blowing my hung laundry.
I giggled and crept in my blanket;

Now, tired from work,
I come home
Just to peek in my balcony for any ghosts.
The wind doesn't blow my laundry anymore.
Unable to sleep,
Stood in my balcony
Smoking the final one left.
The smoke doesn't pass in the dry and cold backdrop,
I hope a ghost sights me and my cry.
Spirited away from people and bondings,
Lost my way in ghost findings.
The year has passed, followed by weeks and days.
My plastic daisies still sit in water, never wet,
All the real ones planted are eons ago dead.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Chronologyüì∞
poems.content:
Memories preserved in my mind
Just like a flower in amber.
The incense of those writings
Still strike me at random times,
Just like phantom smells.
I'll share my poems on next blossoming of Neelkurinji.
Waking alone in such cold,
I get thoughts
Which melt down hearts.
The spotlight effect makes me anxious,
Making me think if I do fit in there.
All I do is have patience,
Till I find the address of Happ'y'ness.

Reaching home,
I realised that the window was open,
And the cat took my poetry book.
No grievance upon that‚Äî
Maybe there is someone destined to read
And admire those unpublished thoughts.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Indestructible
poems.content:
It‚Äôs Me
A fine slit
near the wrist,
alike the horizon.
The sun is a candle flame,
the sea is blood.
The universe is expanding and never-ending,
like my thoughts.

Soon my memories will fade,
and I'll be dead.
My body will be stiff and cold,
like a hailstone.
I'll be burnt‚Äî
the molecules that once bonded
will be incinerated.

I'll soon disintegrate
into atoms.
I'll become part of my mother Earth again.
I'll be free like a griffin,
wandering over the land and sea.
I'll be free like a whale,
exploring the depths of the ocean
and gazing at the heavens.

I would still be me.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Citylights
poems.content:
In this fast-moving city,
I lost so many lines
that could have changed the perspectives of many.

Sitting in a park,
watching city lights,
remembering those lost lines.

Buying a family pack of ice cream,
just for myself‚Äîto last a week.
Trains run late today,
and I have no one waiting for me anyway.

The clock ticks quickly,
everyone is in a hurry.
I see earphones plugged in every ear,
hanging near the door of the train,
barely able to stand.

Wind flows on my face.
The city lights are beautiful,
but the people in them are stressful.

Soon I reached.
Shops were closed,
dogs were asleep,
all the public seemed to have vanished.

Humming songs, I enter the building,
just to realize the lift isn't working.
Climbing the stairs to the 5th floor,
too tired to do anything,
I open the door and lie on the floor.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Nay cureth
poems.content:
A sickness that pulls you away from screens;
a sickness that pulls you away from people;
a sickness that pulls you away from the sea;
a sickness that pulls you away from philosophies;
a sickness that pulls you away from music;
a sickness that pulls you away from books;
a sickness that pulls you away from light.

No, it's not a sickness‚Äî
it‚Äôs a resistance by the mind,
against everything you gave.

O Lord, show your mercy upon this mere human.
But I can't comprehend anything,
and I‚Äôm unwilling to interpret any further
these gifts of yours.

I have fallen.
The demigods witnessed my fall.
The wings are on fire.
The tears have left heaven.
Soon, I will be burnt to ashes.

But I promise you, Lord,
I‚Äôll rise from the ashes.
I‚Äôll soar high.
I‚Äôll make those tremble
who awaited my fall.
I‚Äôll exert my wrath upon them.
I shall spare none‚Äî
but bow to you.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Windows
poems.content:
Let's jump out of the window,
Let's sneak our way into another realm
Where the fishes fly,
Birds swim,
Butterflies soar;

A realm where
The lion's meow and cats roar,
Where the ocean is above and
The clouds are below,
Where it rains flowers,
Where the rivers are filled with sparkling aether,

Where every eve on the next lane smiles at you,
Where the world moves without you taking a step,
Where the sense of distress, sadness, anxiety disappear,
Where the concept of time is non-existent.

The realm is distinct,
But there are other windows to be explored.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Alyeska
poems.content:
I walk where the sea breaks
Witnessing the dawn
The light steps gently on my eyes,
I was moving but my thoughts weren't
.
.
.
I walk where the sea breaks
The quietness of the midday
The heat waves
And the sparkling tides
Were mesmerizing;
The turtles were slow
And the waters flow
Covering and uncovering my feet
The voices of the creatures
Were as loud as graveyard silence
.
.
.
I walk where the sea breaks
Gathering the feelings of love I didn't deserve
The sea was full but the surroundings were empty
The sun was escorted in the sea
Where the streamlets of my tears flowed
Filled with emptiness of everything
.
.
.
I sat where the sea breaks
And the sea is bygone
Now I see the cosmos over my head
And under my feet
I sprawled to watch the cosmos
The stars interstitially filled my voids
The constellations connected my memories
The silence of stars was a lullaby
And then there was no cry.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Blood and Flesh
poems.content:
They interrogated‚Äî
A demon?
Or
An angel?
Echoed: "A human."
Not more, nor less.

Few acts incline towards Satan,
Few towards the divine;
Ultimately, of blood, flesh, and bones‚Äî
Miserable, seeking perfection,
Attaining bliss and dissatisfaction.

An intrigued world shouldn't be bifurcated
When everything lies within one.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: A pale blue dot
poems.content:
Living on a pale blue dot,
I think of swimming across the cosmic ocean,
Experiencing the radiant formation of nebulas.

Sometimes, I think of my solitary life‚Äî
And yet feel joyous, realizing
It is fine to have nothing around you,
Just like the space around planets and suns.

I would become an adult now,
Yet I think of my childhood space odysseys.
The innumerable stars are just like festive lightings‚Äî
But festivals end, and the lights shut.

I know the stars will shut too.
But I'm thankful I will never be in that world
Where there is no star to shine,
No nebulas to watch,
No planets to inhabit.

Living on a pale blue dot,
I thank everything I've got.
The god might be dead,
But the pale blue dot is still not hell.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: The flavor of absurdism
poems.content:
The happenings of life:
The accidents, the discoveries,
The inventions, the findings and meetings,
The seeking, the writings,
The listenings, the paths‚Äî
All seem to interconnect and intertwine.

The masses live in ignorance,
The intellects acknowledge,
The geniuses try to decode,
And the enlightened‚Äîlive.

The knowers perceive the finite mine,
And the miner's freedom is known.

Societies fear
The fire of existentialism,
In the hearts of miners turned rebels,
Cats turned lions,
And fishes turned sharks.

The peculiarity of life
Never had a meaning‚Äî
But it's an act of a fool
To quit and impart misery
By such an understanding.

Thus, societies, religions, and fearful leaders,
Afraid of collapse,
Tame the fools,
To not perceive the peculiarity.

The knowers don't attempt to disclose
The myths of reasoning behind the workings.

The fights are never meant to end‚Äî
Between races, religions, ideas,
Languages, and civilizations.

Rather, the delusions over algorithms
Backtrack to irrationality,
Even after near-infinite solutions.

Theories of the present contradict the past,
And so will the theories of the future
Contradict the present.

The only cure to the disease of undenied,
Illusionary worldly workings,
And the entropy of the universe, is‚Äî
To cut off all expectations and hopes,
Knowing and accepting chaos and futility;

Only then can one taste
The authentic freedom of such life,
And conclude:
The highly overrated phenomenon
Of life on a pale blue dot.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Beyond the borders
poems.content:
The earbuds fell off,
The pages start to flip.
The inner maniac seeks instability,
The banging on walls and desk has its regularity.
The screams shatter the glass,
The excitement has no limits.
..
The maniac fades with all his highs,
And the great depression finds its way.
The painful past creeps in slowly,
And the movements become blunt.
..
The depression and mania walk back to their castles.
The strawberry juice soothes the soul.
The midnight is lightened by the full moon,
The city has gone silent,
And the flow of thoughts approaches null.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Mumbai Rain
poems.content:
It always starts all of a sudden,
And delights every sullen one.
College was over,
And it was time to leave for home.
..
Running from one shade of a shop to another,
Getting wet every time I ran,
I quit running and felt like walking,
Experiencing each drop of rain soaking my hair,
And sliding down my face.
..
Wet enough now to start sneezing,
I spotted a chai stall,
And went to get my soul warm.
The chai was like ambrosia;
The warmth of the vapors was more than the atmosphere,
Yet just enough.
..
No sooner had the heavy rains begun,
Than I was stranded there with an empty cup.
I paused to acknowledge the Mumbai rains.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Decision
poems.content:
Wandering in the mountains,
I heard the waters.
The thirst was unavoidable,
And the sound of running water was melodious.

Reaching the river,
I sat to drink the elixir.
There, I saw my reflection‚Äî
A face that spoke a lot.

I reflected victory and sunshine.
The scent of flowers and fruits surrounded me.
The modern devil had no reflection left;
Even its impressions were far behind.

The elixir made me feel more alive,
And the air around was pure.
I am not around nature‚Äî
I am the nature.

The unadulterated fruits felt like gifts from Adam himself.
Observing the fishes, the animals, the birds,
I realized even they are bound by water, land, and air,
Yet happy and peaceful.

Humans, conquering water, land, and space,
Never rose above their world of complaints and falseness.
I am happy to choose this life,
With no comparison to them.

Now, for me, the Amazon awaits.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: They exist
poems.content:
There is always someone out there,
Waiting by their window,
Watching the sun set,
Letting the darkness possess their house‚Äî
But not their heart.

They don‚Äôt cry anymore.
They don‚Äôt daydream anymore.
Just like you, they don‚Äôt expect anymore.

The books are lifeless now.
Dust covers their plants,
Yet they water them daily.

We don‚Äôt wake up early,
But we are awake inwardly.
Time moves, and so shall we.

They neglected you,
Yet you grew.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Summonings
poems.content:
The empowerment and dominance of the human species
Have led to the distortion and dissolution of the race.
God seemed dead, and the worshipers were wiped from existence‚Äî
A few remained, exiled to the unmanned orb,
Anticipating the arrival of the Messiah.

Years passed, and the doomed civilization,
Once blinded, sought realization
Upon the arrival of the Messiah:
‚ÄúThe god is dead.‚Äù
Nevertheless, faith shall sustain.

We looked up toward the skies,
Thanking the unnamed and uncanny potent.
A belief, a religion, was formed‚Äî
With us worshiping nothingness
And the one that is not.

The once misled and cruel sought peace,
Colonizing the unmanned orbs,
Forming vast empires built upon the graves of the na√Øve.

The internal battles ended with the revival of faith;
The prophets were sent back to their graves,
The Messiah vanished into the coldness.

The summonings gather us still‚Äî
To worship, even in the darkness.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: The journey of sele
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: ‡§∂‡•Ç‡§®‡•ç‡§Ø‡§§‡§æü™ê
poems.content:
Inanity has surrounded me,
The voices no longer interact;
They all seem shunned,
Or rather, damped.
The paths have evaporated;
The lights of the divine are shut.
The paint over pain
Now wears off.
The cracks of insults and bricks of abuse are visible,
But no one remains to judge.
Life has seemingly lost its meaning,
Or perhaps life itself is non-existent.

.
.
.

The way out of this prison of diffidence is to break:
The walls and bricks,
The glasses and mirrors,
The hearts and minds.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: smile
poems.content:
No matter how bad your day is,
Or if she broke up,
No matter if the sky is red,
Or if it rains,
No matter if they didn‚Äôt say goodbye,
Or if they did,
No matter if you missed your train,
Or if you had to take a taxi,
No matter if you fail,
Or if you frightened a kitten‚Äî

What does it take
To have a seaward dip and skyward end,
That brings radiance to the face
And bliss to the world around?
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Containment.
poems.content:
It lurks within me.
It is fueled by anger.
The people around me disturb its permanence.
When aloof, it screams.

The internal conflict between us
Is that of a snake and eagle.
The world tests my patience with their acts.
The killer instincts demand
To devour the noisy creatures,
To tear them apart,
To feed upon their screams,
To crush their bones and make them count each,
To suck their blood, to attain unimaginable peace.

The seemingly weak vessel
Bears the burden
Of containing such horror.
Yet it copes with the black world.
The walls of the chamber
Are cracked by innumerable punches.

If it breaks,
The world shall be ready to bear
The aftermath,
As the ogre wishes to enslave the dead,
By slashing every human
Until the noise of their wicked and unruly thoughts vanishes.
And leaves me alone to suffer or to enjoy the silence.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: L'amour est indiff√©renci√©.
poems.content:
Pour certains,
Ton amour est comme le tournesol qui se tourne vers les rayons du soleil,
Pour certains,
Ton amour est comme l'herbe dans leur jardin,
Pour certains,
C'est comme Pluton,
Pour certains,
L'amour est de courte dur√©e,
Pour certains,
L'amour signifie le changement,
Pour certains,
l'amour est aveugle,
Et certains sont aveugles.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Obsessions
poems.content:
Obsessed with writing,
Obsessed with reading,
Obsessed with poems,
Obsessed with art,
Obsessed with love,
Obsessed with success,
Yet have to deal with failure
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: I...
poems.content:
I bleed poetry,
I smell love,
I see words,
I hear music,
I feel warmth,
I taste sweet,
I do not speak.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Strangers
poems.content:
I stand and long for someone.
I hithered and thithered,
Until
I stood along the lane and saw her,
An elegant, bloomed, and frustrated stranger.

We glanced at each other at mismatched instances.
Anon, we understood our appetency for one another.
No sooner had she come near me
Than I felt a billow of unspoken dialogues, questions, and feelings hit me.

The wait was over for me,
And
I left without looking back at her.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: A Life
poems.content:
He gently moved his hand over the armchair.
He held the wood firmly and sat.
The sunny day reminded him
Of when he sat on a swing with his mother beside him.

He blinked his eyes slowly, syncing with a tortoise‚Äôs walk.
The wind that blew
Reminded him of the long drive he had taken with his love.

He moved his hands over his skin, sensing the folds, curves, and bones.
The sound of thunder
Reminded him of his travel days with his dog.

He grabbed the hand mirror; now he looked pale with shallow eyes.
He lit a cigarette.
The smoke and fire
Reminded him of the funeral of his son.

He tapped his legs.
The music reminded him of his wedding day.
The seasides reminded him of his successes and failures.
The fragrance of flowers
Reminded him of his retirement.

The birds, the ants, and the squirrels gathered near him,
As if they were listening.
The buses and busy streets reminded him of his job.

He had now lived every moment of his life fully.
Now he smiled, and they mourned as he departed, lively.

The chai remained unsipped.
The carvaan played songs.
The windows were left open.
The newspaper was left unread.
The diaries and belongings were left inside a secret dorm.

He would leave the world, but he had lived every moment.
He loved the smell of soil when it rained.
Leaving his last words, he said:
"Life is in the moment, and I love her till the very end."
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Raindrops
poems.content:
Yesterday, it rained.
I felt it asked me on a date.
I grabbed my umbrella and went for the date.

The noises in my mind and the city fell silent.
All I could hear were the raindrops falling onto my umbrella
And sliding down towards the earth.

Each drop reminded me of the sad, sullen moments of my life.
I was unable to find the cause of such great sadness,
Just my past happenings echoing with the sound of each drop.

The cuts were deep and the blood was dripping on the ground.
I thought of dressing those wounds,
But I could not find them.
They exist in the past,
Impact the present,
And with each drop on the ground,
I expect the next one from the future.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Doomed
poems.content:
I walked past the lamppost,
Experiencing the silence of space.
The disruption by the thunder
Reminded me of life.

The rain mirrored new people,
And the darkness was analogous to my memories.
The unused umbrella of wit within
Stayed folded and still.

The petrichor rejoiced me, like a cat when it yawns.
The moss on street walls echoed every smile of mine,
And the sliding drops echoed the misery that followed.

The sharp rays of headlights reminded me of their words.
The empty trashcan mocked the great loner
Who could not carry roses but only thorns.

The broken doll whined for the corpse
Carrying itself to the grave of society.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Mon amour, mon amour.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Gravity
poems.content:
I crave to see you,
But eons past I saw you,
I crave to confer with you,
But eons past, my words faltered,
I crave to rediscover the bond,
But eons past I lost my chance,
I ache for your love,
But the gravity of mine
Would consume yours;
The time we spent felt like years,
Remembering those I shed tears;
I yearn to let go,
Howbiet my gravity of love beholds;
At length I'll perish,
And my once sought stargaze
Alter into mist;
I wonder,
If my ink
Will ever make you think,
If my letters,
Will ever flood your heart with love, 
If my words,
Will ever bridge the chasm between us.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: The Local
poems.content:
Life is like a train travel,
The ticket epitomes birth, 
The platform epitomes the chance to stand,
The horns epitome opportunities,
The sight of arriving train represents manifestation,
The first class epitomes elite dreams,
The second class,
A middle class dream,
Filled with claimants already,
With dead looks firing rejection beams,
The cell is filled with pain and misery,
Crushing you from all sides,
With the force of norms of the society,
With every next stop the cell gets empty,
And the sky gets clear,
The views of the scenes passing by, 
Epitomes the happenings,
Remember your travel is long,
And it might feel lonely,
But till you reach your destiny,
The tracks will humm for you,
The winds will refresh you,
And your talks with her will carry you through.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Longing..
poems.content:
I won‚Äôt run behind you,
I want to run with you.
I won‚Äôt watch the sunset
Until‚Ä¶
My hands are tangled in yours,
My feet touching yours,
And my eyes set on yours.

As the sun goes down,
I lean on you.
Our hearts now glue,
And our love stays true.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Porcupine
poems.content:
Anything I loved, perished, 
Anything I wished, vanquished,
Anything I touched, dissolved,
Anything I saw, burnt,
Anywhere I went, turned barren and sterile,
Anyone I conversed with, shattered,
In the midst of this void,
I pine for a glimpse of hope.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: The heart is squashed
poems.content:
Today‚Äôs night is the hardest.
A war has begun,
Between you and yourself,
Your saddened heart and your aggressive mind.

The mission is to survive,
To thrive, and to make efforts to be alive.
The war is stupid,
And so is the reason.

The clock seems to stop working,
But you‚Äôll sleep.
The anxiety has put its guard down,
The shyness bows,
The anger walks away.
The smiles have lost their strength,
The love is lonely,
And now brags,
Asks for mocks,
But none remain.

Today‚Äôs night is the hardest.
The war has begun.
The soldiers of hope are cold,
The expectations fight upfront.
The ground of reality
Breaks apart.

The realism bridges are built,
But soon they are crushed and crumbled.
The squashed heart bleeds,
The tsunami of sorrow and pain
Swallows all.

Today‚Äôs night is the hardest.
The war has ended.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: I commit
poems.content:
Blest are those who can cry,
I long for tears,
But they are too shy,
Around thy my life steers
I drive as the fog clears;

Along my way,
I sight roses,
To make her forgive the delay, 
For good luck I carried posies;

I bleed as the thorns pierce,
The roses seem to now smear,
But my will is fierce,
As the destination gets near,
My love turns into fear;

As I reach, 
I search for you,
But all I see is an empty beach, 
The silence of shore,
Makes me want you more,
And your absence
Left my heart sore;

Now I commit waiting,
For the living to visit dead.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: sold soul
poems.content:
I sold my soul
And sat by the sea.
The night served as my blanket,
And the rains arrived to join my tears.

With every tide
And with every sip,
My pain dissipates.
The thunder tried talking,
Unaware of my suffering.

My memories serve as fuel
When played on loop.
The universe shivers
As my thoughts shatter.
Now the thunder fears
As my wounds become clear.

I wish you knew
How much I think about you.
As the mind is silenced
And the heart is fenced,
All worldly judgments now balanced.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Rites & sights.
poems.content:
My heart‚Äôs on pyre,
Without the fear of fire.
The mind stands still,
Witnessing the kill.

The emotions sob,
Irrespective of their job.
The tyrannical drunk mocks,
Carrying heartlocks.

The drunk now asks,
When will you burn the masks?
Eternity giggles
As the heart wiggles.

The burning desire burns it all,
As per the hellion call.
As the heart fades,
The twilight aids.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Metaphorical thought
poems.content:
The world is eternal sky,
And me,
A butterfly,
You seek to catch me,
Yet I always flee;
I know I am free,
And I am set to fly;
I am an illusion
Perceived by mind of thy,
I let go my dye,
And deceive in nature's shades,
If only thy had known,
I am love and I don't have an end.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Reflections
poems.content:
I lit my present,
I sip my past,
I puff away my future.

I let the rains wet my plants,
I let the wind play with my hair,
I let the thoughts elope with fire.

I sleep with my shadow,
I wake up with my foggy dreams,
I churn gratitude and misery.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Un jourü™¶ü•Ä
poems.content:
One day, it will all end,
But your heart won‚Äôt mend.

The glimpse of butterflies will remind you of my sweetness,
While I am suffering from solitary illness.

The silence of the shore will remind you of your past times,
But the poems will make you sail on my rhymes.

Your once-sought worldly figures will shatter you now and then,
Always remember my aura will be waiting for you down the lane.

In your life‚Äôs garden, my roses will bloom,
And my once-shared affection will fill your heart‚Äôs room.

The tears will question you,
As your soul hovers over the gray hue.

When the world turns to gloom, the roses that were once taken for granted
Will then be wanted.

It may be late,
But you will never be unwanted.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Wish-list
poems.content:
Oh, shooting star,
I whisper my yearning plea;
Make her my moon,
And me the endless sea.

Oh, shooting star,
Answer my soul‚Äôs call;
End my suffering,
And make my sadness fall.

Oh, shooting star,
Sway the clouds so oblique,
End this game of hide and seek.
As the moonlight arrives,
It sparkles my tears as I cry.

Oh, shooting star,
Etch my words upon her heart,
Heal her pain and mend every part,
And let my love restart.

Oh, shooting star,
Let my love flood her thoughts,
And tighten our knots.

Oh, shooting star,
Let the child within us never depart;
In our silliness and joy,
Find a lifelong art.

Oh, shooting star,
Keep my eyes clear
To see the butterflies
In the moments most dear.

Oh, shooting star,
Burn me in truth with my art,
But bury me forever within her heart.

Oh, dear love,
May this always hold true;
For eternity, let me love you.
I hope you feel the same,
And see the clue within my flame.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: The Convict's Confession
poems.content:
My life a prison,
With society as bars.
The walls, my canvas,
The carvings, my art.
The window a mirage,
And the reality, window bars.

The room so dark,
With an air of my past.
Time has no meaning,
Yet affects all that lasts.

Strength is undetermined.
The once-sought dream
Of touching the skies,
Running across daisy fields,
Swimming in the Pacific,
And the idea of ultimate freedom,
With writings of love,
All shunned for the crime committed once.

The heart of the dead,
The mind of a slave.
With every new day,
The sins burn away,
Yet the marks remain, so eminent.

A crime so brutal
It left God and devil rattled.
The soggy silence broke
As I spoke:
A crime to hate thyself and disown one‚Äôs essence,
Leading to lifelong woe, a haunting presence.

Now I seek redemption
By breaking the prison of my own creation,
Freeing myself from the shackles of assumptions, expectations, and deceptions,
To meet my awaited freedom
And seek life‚Äôs blossom.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Man‚Äôs Search for Meaning
poems.content:
When lost in the desert, we seek water.
When caught in a snowstorm, we cry for fire.
When the forest begins to consume, we run for food.
When trapped in a deep cave, we yearn for a beam of light.
When tangled in pain, we crave love.
When the world fails to help, we beg for grace.
When lost in the labyrinth of life, we seek ourselves
In the depths of love.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: A Play
poems.content:
Life, a game of chess.
The queen, your lover,
Always closer.

The pawns, your folks,
Having your back with their jokes.

The rooks, your brothers,
Who never fear others.

The bishops, your friends,
Knowing all ends.

The knights, God‚Äôs grace,
Arriving in times of chase.

Life, a game of chess.
And you, the king of whites.
With darks as angels,
And whites as archangels.

The moves, your decision,
Thought with precision.
The claims, your success,
Erecting pillars of progress.

The loss captures pain,
But your moves won‚Äôt go vain.

As time slips,
End comes near.
Whether victory or defeat,
Death is inevitable.

Life‚Äôs chessboard won‚Äôt ever fade.
The players come and go,
The sides change.
The moves never end,
Meant to be played each and every day.

A God‚Äôs boon, or life‚Äôs fate?
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Entangled Hearts
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Unbroken Spirits
poems.content:
Out of my sight,
in the brightest light;
With my voice, in the darkest times,
making me forget the committed crimes;

Escaping life's maze,
while eloping through life's dual phase;
The boundaries all set to anchor us in place,
yet we break the shackles,
a wildfire's race.

Eyes moisten as the knot's ablaze,
they try to bury the sweetest craze;
The feet now burn,
as the fire makes turns;
Our hearts so brave,
to complete the chase,
for the burning desire which won't fade.


The faith is strong
to sail the storms,
to cross the mountains
and sight the dawn.

May the world set afire,
or turn haywire,
yet we'll soar higher,
to fulfill our promise and seek our desire.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: A Heartfire Satire
poems.content:
In spine-chilling cold,
I walk down the road,
only to seek my alienation cure.
They stalk me as I pave my way through snow,
with every next step whispers of theirs make me scare.

The fire in heart burns no more,
for someone I once sought now buried, covered up by snow.
Screams can't be unheard as I pass by the graves,
all my dear ones too are dead.

Some beer now seems to aid,
yet the memory doesn't fade.
The wars I fought now all seem child's play,
the cigars once soothed,
now break my breath.

Colours of the world all seem gray,
some bit dark, some bit bright.
In this sullen tunnel of delusion, the foul soul cries for heaven's guiding light.

December's nights extend long,
couldn't stop me from singing the song.
Now death arrives as heaven's grace at my doorstep,
only to be welcomed with lights, gifts,
and chocolates.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Chronicles of shadows and united spirits.
poems.content:
In darkest times the nights unfold,
Let there be someone, who's hand I can hold,
To listen to the stories of summer untold, 
Heartbeats blend, as stories unfold,
With power so potent where dimensions fold. 

Skin over skin, the love disperse, 
Eyes dilate, to swallow all curse;
Lips dance, to and fro,
To kill the sorrow, and create a want to explore more.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Urban Thoughts and City Love
poems.content:
Don't chase butterflies, they say,
now look at how dull you get
as they stay away.
I hope you understand there exists fate.

Don't cross oceans for those who can't cross puddles for you,
now look at how dry and dead you look
as those same ones walk away from puddles without giving you a clue.
Now you hope for a person whom you can book.

Human love is based on the foundation of trials
and experiences from life's trails.
Be boundless
and approach it all that you just think.
Sometimes all that you expected may happen in an eyeblink.

But never hesitate or fear
when they get near.
Assume it to be your last day and last hour,
express yourself to the fullest power.

Never let them stop,
never let them start.
The aim is sure to be achieved
when you use love's dart.

I hope that you survive each and every phase,
but never quit your curiosity's chase.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Passionate Hate
poems.content:
Thirst for love,
fire in eyes,
melting all possible minds.

A vase so godly,
holding the ether of ego so great.
Judgmental it may seem,
but I hate the way you stare.
Deep in your heart lies some care.

The mismatched entries and exits,
some sign of disagreements,
a talk we never had,
a walk we never shared,
a hate we never truly expressed,
joy and bliss we never considered to be in presence of our case.

The flames within me, so wild,
vaporizing any blooming thoughts that may rise.
The fields burn with flowers still intact,
when the fiery eyes meet my sight.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Modern Insecurities
poems.content:
Oh love, my love,
I am grateful for your presence,
for which I penanced on endless nights.

Our bond holds dear to me than my life,
the will to be an oyster and store this pearl of love,
and to forever get sunken in the depths of affection and connections.

Hideous it is, and let it be,
worldly views and their jealous sights
cannot snatch you away from me.

May seem possessive,
but a will to spend the life blossoming this love,
to bloom enough to swallow the universe
and aspire to create new,
just for you and me.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: End It Well
poems.content:
No more sunrises,
the dark comforts more.
No more cold,
the warmth my new comfort.

Walks desired with you,
under an umbrella of love,
all replaced with sprints in monsoon.

I end it all with no chances to escape,
trying to seek one will result in execution of self.

Stay free,
stay strong,
the mind's your slave,
forever that stays true.

If the moon shines at dawn, then
take a break and kill the host.
May turn a ghost, yet thy will be free
among the land of dead,
in lieu of living like a slave.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Renaissance
poems.content:
A little did I know,
how potent I was.
Amid the rush,
I gained many and lost many.
Some came by themselves,
some were being called upon.

Lightly I took myself
and ignored all of the atrophy caused.
I regret the decision and the day I chose them over myself.
And when there were none,
ritualistically I whined
and broke all that I possessed.

The reflection of unhonoured self felt a disgrace upon the choices made.
The silence broke as the Lord bestowed His words,
"Thou art that."

Enlightened by the guidance,
I sought the path of the Lord
to reclaim the ruins
and build the holy temple
for the god within myself.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Eden's Tale of Hell
poems.content:
I have set the tree of love on fire.
My tears can't and never would extinguish this fire.
The leaves of hope are being burnt first.
The branches holding blissful moments now turn into smoke,
the smoke holding pain, dampness, and emptiness of the end.

The trunk of emotions burns as well,
slowly burning,
as heavy as the emotions were.

I thought to extinguish the fire with water of forgiveness,
yet was stopped by the winds of regret.

The roots finally catch the fire,
holding initium of an awful end.
Barren land with ashes remains,
only to remind of the end for any initium taken.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Metamorphic
poems.content:
The new year's resolution
is to give my absolution.

I killed myself.
I am floating over my past self.

Plastic smiles stood to be the cause of my heartfire's pyre.
I cook my leftover philosophies over this pyre's fire,
as aftermath's meal.

The fault was mine
to hand over the sword
to those undeserving ones.
They pierced it through layers of my mind,
mocking the vulnerable fool.

I lay over my mistakes,
with the ego humbled by sun's rays,
simultaneously nourished and nurtured by winds of ending change,
forging afterlife's defence.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Love with a Loss
poems.content:
Discoveries of new paths,
old riddles solved.
Universe, a thought
inside a tiny mortal mind so wrought.

Everything I thought,
every battle I fought,
every goal I sought,
every achievement I got,
all of which I forgot
when her enchanting beauty had my heart caught.

On a pale blue dot, a moment so slight,
yet the essence of love transcends day and night,
which holds power to make the cosmos bend.

Little did I know
that this light of love was followed by pain's dark blend.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: L'amour Commence
poems.content:
My heartbeats gush
as she gets near in a hush.
When her hand meets mine,
my feelings go wild,
and my worries are exiled.

My face enlightens
when her gaze meets mine.
Her smile comforts me with warmth of affection,
alike Eden's graceful creation.

I always cherish these little happenings,
knowing I may not be her Adam,
yet she'll always be my Eve.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Out of Breath
poems.content:
Out of breath,
behold Death!
Awaits my love at the bay.
Ships come, then go,
but mine sunk,
cause of an illness driven drunk.

Oh Lord, thanks for the ship,
but now I seek to wage the war of wrath for love's sake,
the love which was unseen,
unheard, and unfulfilled.
And all I asked for was a life with her so gay.

Oh Lord,
awaits my love at the bay.
Now my illness drowns,
drowns my hope.
My grave won't exist,
but hers would be at the bay by the half-built home with a rose.

Running out of breath,
a life full of struggle for a good breath just to catch up to my love at the bay before my end.
Incomplete feels the story,
but it was completed before it was spoken.

His destiny a planned maze game.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Valentine
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Knight's Note
poems.content:
She's the charm of the kingdom,
I am the knight amongst.
My pockets all empty with heart full of love;
couldn't gift her roses,
with hands smeared in blood.

Her palace, a heaven for the subjects,
for me, the fortress, my heaven.
The moon may get lost,
the sun may burn out,
the earth may turn cold;
but the knot for eternity between the knight and the battlefield is never cut by any sword.

Paths differ since the dawn,
a knight always meant to protect,
and for him, the concept of love and peace
is just a mirage.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: If She Writes
poems.content:
The way he smiles,
the way he talks,
the way he looks,
the way he walks;

I'm consumed by love's idea,
not for love's own sake,
but as an excuse to meet him again and again,
perhaps walking down some lanes,
and when it rains,
without any constraint of time and space.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: I Met Her
poems.content:
She's the most beautiful woman I've ever met.
My words break,
my heart melts,
my mind buffers,
my hands shiver,
my thoughts scatter,
my script fails,
the time slows,
and my love for her just grows.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: A Home Full of Love
poems.content:
They say, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt chase love,
for love will find you.‚Äù
But when I found you,
you smiled and said:
‚ÄúYou found me.
You are my love.
So tell me, love‚Ä¶
what am I to you?‚Äù
To which I replied:
‚ÄúI found my home.‚Äù
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Who Is She?
poems.content:
She's the sun's first ray,
and I am a sunflower.
She's the melody in Monday blues,
and I am the passenger on the bus.
She's the afternoon nap,
and I am the sleeper.
She's the first bite of chocolate,
and I am the diabetic.
She's the happiness surrounding kids,
and I am the kid.
She's the sunset,
and I am the sea.
She's the city's night lights,
and I am the train traveler.
She's the fragrance of new books,
and I am the reader.
She's home,
and I am the one lying on the floor.
She's a godsent angel,
and I am the priest.
She's the night's sleep,
and I am the dreamer.
She's the essence of love,
and I am love itself.
poems.author: Sahil Rane

poems.title: Alive
poems.content:
Ever looked at the moon and stood frozen?
Ever heard the rustling of leaves as the winds blow and sat beneath the trees?
Ever drank water after a tiring day and felt how it ran through your body?
These are a few, if not all, moments one should be grateful for and acknowledge.

Money will come,
People will come,
Opportunities will come,

But remember that you are alive.
You were made to feel, to immerse, to enjoy life.

Learn to love, not hate;
Learn to trust, not betray;
Learn to stay, not run;
Learn to express, not suppress.

Life, in the end, is a big puzzle we all play.
Pick your pieces,
Craft their shapes,
Life will flow and put them in their place.

And when you glimpse one last time,
You‚Äôll be in pure bliss and joy.
poems.author: Sahil Rane
